title: India concerned over trade hostility by Dhaka but may avoid tit-for-tat
content: Despite strained trade relations and anti-India sentiments from Dhaka, India aims to avoid a trade war with Bangladesh. Recent actions, like withdrawing a trans-shipment facility, were intended to ease congestion, not harm Bangladesh's trade. Concerns rise over Bangladesh's renewed ties with Pakistan, especially amid increasing radicalization, as Pakistan seeks to boost exports and high-level contacts resume.

title: Trump admin asks IRS to strip Harvard’s tax-exempt status
content: The Trump administration formally requested the IRS to revoke Harvard University's tax-exempt status, alleging a failure to adequately address antisemitism on campus. This action follows increased scrutiny of elite universities and a DOJ review of Harvard's federal contracts and grants. President Trump has criticized Harvard, accusing it of promoting hate and failing its students.

title: As US visa slots dry up, students may miss 2025 target
content: Thousands of Ahmedabad students planning to study in the US this summer are facing visa appointment delays. Since mid-March, securing visa interview slots has become increasingly difficult, causing stress for students with university admissions and I-20 forms. The recent US embassy crackdown on illegal visa appointment methods and potential changes in immigration policies are adding to the uncertainty.

title: Alliance with BJP only for TN assembly polls, not for coalition govt: EPS
content: Edappadi K Palaniswami clarified that AIADMK's alliance with BJP is solely for the 2026 election, not a commitment to a coalition government. He emphasized respecting each party's autonomy, while BJP's Nainar Nagenthran stated coalition decisions rest with party leaders. Palaniswami criticized DMK's discomfort, asserting the alliance aims for Tamil Nadu's development.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for April 17
content: Jefferies is bearish on Mahanagar Gas due to reduced APM gas allocation, while Nuvama cuts ICICI Lombard's target despite premium growth. Nomura is bullish on Aditya Birla Real Estate, citing strong pre-sales. Investec upgrades Eicher Motors on Royal Enfield's rebound, while Morgan Stanley maintains an 'equal weight' rating on IndusInd Bank, awaiting audit clarity.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Ross Gerber said in an interview recently that Elon Musk “doesn’t care” about the electric car manufacturer. He also defended his criticism after a backlash from retail investors.

title: Trans women not legally ‘women’ under Equality Act, rules UK Supreme Court
content: The UK Supreme Court has ruled that the term "woman" in the Equality Act 2010 exclusively refers to biological females, impacting single-sex services. This unanimous decision, favoring For Women Scotland, distinguishes between "sex" and "gender reassignment," potentially affecting equal pay and access to services.

title: 'Trump officials may face criminal contempt for defying deportation halt'
content: A US district judge has found probable cause to hold Trump administration officials in criminal contempt for defying court orders. These orders had blocked the deportation of alleged Venezuelan gang members under the Alien Enemies Act. Despite the judge's mid-March ruling, the government proceeded with deportations to El Salvador, leading to political and legal backlash.

title: Trump is 'escalating' Harvard University fight; Elon Musk 'joins in' & picks side
content: A clash has erupted between Donald Trump and Harvard University over governance, hiring, and admissions, including demands to shut diversity offices. After Harvard rejected these demands, citing constitutional rights, the White House froze $2.2 billion in federal funding. Elon Musk has weighed in, supporting Trump's call to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status.

title: Why was Michel kept in cell with 'desperate accused': Court to Tihar
content: A Delhi court has demanded an explanation from Tihar Jail authorities regarding the co-location of Christian Michel James, an AgustaWestland case suspect, with undertrial Shahnawaz, despite the latter's history of disciplinary issues. James alleges inmates cut deals for special treatment and recounts surviving poisoning attempts during his six-year imprisonment.

title: JD Vance, wife to visit India next week, to meet PM on April 21
content: US Vice President J D Vance is scheduled to visit India from April 21 to 24, accompanied by his family and senior Trump administration officials. During his first visit to India, Vance will meet Prime Minister Modi on April 21.

title: What went wrong after Elon Musk ‘proposed’ Tiffany Fong to have his child
content: Crypto influencer Tiffany Fong gained fame after Elon Musk followed her on Twitter. Musk reportedly asked Fong to have his child, which she declined. Fong shared this with friends, including Ashley St. Clair. Musk, upset by the lack of discretion, unfollowed Fong. This led to a decline in her followers and earnings. Musk has thirteen children with three women.

title: Abrupt visa termination: Indian student, 3 others sue Trump admin
content: Four international students from Michigan universities, including one from India, are suing the Department of Homeland Security. They allege their student visas were abruptly terminated without explanation, jeopardizing their studies and risking deportation. The ACLU of Michigan is representing the students, arguing the terminations were based on minor interactions with law enforcement and are deterring future international scholars.

title: 'Control' Shah, Didi urges Modi, terms Bengal violence planned
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused BJP of orchestrating communal riots in Murshidabad over the new waqf law, alleging the involvement of central agencies and Home Minister Amit Shah. She questioned the urgency of amending the waqf Act amid the volatile situation in Bangladesh. Banerjee also criticized the BSF's role in the violence and threatened action.

title: Patrick Mahomes and Brittany Mahomes take a full-on family trip
content: Patrick Mahomes spends offseason with Brittany Mahomes, Sterling, Bronze, and baby Golden Raye, making time for Disney, fishing, and full-time parenting.

title: How one of India’s biggest jobs scandals was executed
content: The Calcutta High Court and Supreme Court invalidated the 2016 West Bengal School Selection Commission recruitment process due to widespread manipulation. Approximately 25,000 teaching and non-teaching staff appointments were cancelled, revealing a scam involving manipulated mark sheets, rank jumping, and appointments of ineligible candidates. Investigations exposed destroyed records and the creation of supernumerary posts to accommodate fraudulent appointments.

title: SC on Urdu use: Language shouldn't divide society
content: The Supreme Court has emphasized that India's linguistic diversity should be celebrated, not be a cause for division. The court upheld the use of Urdu, alongside Marathi, on a signboard in Maharashtra, dismissing the misconception that Urdu is foreign to India. It cautioned against associating language with religion, highlighting Urdu's Indian origin and its role in the nation's cultural heritage.

title: 'What's going on with our courts?': Trump lashes out after judge blocks deportation
content: Donald Trump attacked the American judiciary. This followed a judge's decision. The judge stopped his administration's plan. The plan aimed to cancel protections for over half a million migrants. Trump used Truth Social to voice his anger. He accused the courts of bias. He claimed they were obstructing his agenda. The judge in question is Indira Talwani.

title: Pentagon orders to make nuclear triggers superfast
content: A recent Pentagon directive mandates nuclear weapon delivery within two minutes of message receipt, coinciding with the accelerated development of the B61-13 bomb, 24 times more powerful than the Hiroshima bomb. This directive, revealed in an unclassified document, aims to expedite nuclear command and control operations.

title: ED quizzes Vadra for 2nd day; he says 'not scared of anyone'
content: Robert Vadra appeared before the Enforcement Directorate for the second day concerning a money laundering probe into a 2008 land deal involving his company and DLF. Accompanied by Priyanka Gandhi, Vadra asserted that he is a political target and his family is not afraid of anyone. He expressed frustration with repeated summons, claiming the agencies are being misused.

title: No one has licence to loot, Gandhis must answer charges: BJP
content: BJP dismissed Congress's vendetta claims after the Gandhis were charged in the National Herald case, asserting that no one is above the law. Ravi Shankar Prasad urged Congress to address the allegations, highlighting the misappropriation of real estate worth thousands of crores. Sudhanshu Trivedi clarified that the probe began in 2013 under the UPA government, refuting claims of political vendetta.

title: Will you allow Muslims in Hindu trusts?: SC to Centre
content: The Supreme Court, during a hearing on petitions challenging Waqf Act changes, acknowledged some provisions as beneficial but sought clarification on others. Concerns were raised regarding 'waqf by user' property scrutiny and the inclusion of non-Muslim members in Waqf bodies.

title: West Bengal Police forms nine-member SIT to probe Murshidabad violence
content: Following violent protests in Murshidabad, West Bengal, over the Waqf Amendment Act, the state police have formed a Special Investigation Team to investigate the unrest. The demonstrations, which resulted in fatalities and property damage, prompted the deployment of BSF personnel at the request of the state government.

title: Flight makes emergency landing due to engine fire caused by 'rabbit strike'
content: A United Airlines flight, en route from Denver to Edmonton, was compelled to make an emergency return to Denver due to an engine fire shortly after takeoff. Preliminary reports suggest the fire was triggered by the engine ingesting an animal, possibly a rabbit.

title: Restore green cover or be ready for jail: Supreme Court to Telangana
content: The Supreme Court expressed strong disapproval of the Telangana government's actions. The government felled trees and removed green cover in Kancha Gachibowli forest. The court warned of potential jail time for senior officers. This is if the green cover is not restored. The court emphasized its commitment to protecting the environment. It demanded a revival plan for the damaged area.

title: Not a whiff of crime, it's a hit job by BJP to divert focus: Congress
content: Congress has denounced the ED's National Herald case as a politically motivated attack orchestrated by the BJP, asserting that Young India, a not-for-profit entity, has not engaged in any financial impropriety. AICC leaders highlighted the absence of any crime under relevant laws, accusing the Modi government of diverting attention from critical issues like unemployment and economic decline.

title: IPL 2025: Delhi Capitals edge Rajasthan Royals in Super Over thriller
content: In a thrilling IPL 2025 encounter, Delhi Capitals secured a dramatic Super Over victory against Rajasthan Royals. Mitchell Starc's composed bowling in the final over and Super Over restricted Rajasthan, while Tristan Stubbs sealed the win with a six. Sandeep Sharma struggled under pressure, faltering in both the final over and Super Over.

title: Pentagon top official Colin Carroll third to be sent on leave amid leaks probe
content: Colin Carroll, a senior Pentagon official, has been placed on administrative leave amidst an investigation into information leaks within the Department of Defense. He is the third Pentagon official to be put on leave, joining Dan Caldwell and Darin Selnick.

title: Karnataka governor refers 4% Muslim quota bill for President's assent
content: Karnataka Governor Thaawar Chand Gehlot has sent a bill proposing 4% Muslim reservation in government contracts to the President, citing constitutional concerns. The BJP opposed the bill, arguing against religion-based quotas. PM Modi criticized the Congress, accusing them of infringing on SC, ST, and OBC rights.

title: Former SC judge Maheshwari appointed 23rd law panel chair
content: Justice Dinesh Maheshwari, a former Supreme Court judge, has been appointed as the chairman of the 23rd Law Commission by the Central Government. The commission's responsibilities include submitting a report on the Uniform Civil Code (UCC), studying laws impacting the poor, and identifying laws hindering India's economic progress. The 23rd Law Commission will be functional until August 2027.

title: Aim is to boost states' autonomy sans hurting nation's unity: TN panel chief
content: Justice Kurian Joseph will lead a Tamil Nadu committee to explore greater state autonomy within constitutional limits, addressing long-standing Centre-state issues. The committee will delve into financial autonomy, the role of governors, and other unresolved grievances, drawing from past commissions like Sarkaria and Punchhi. Justice Joseph accepted the role pro bono, upholding his commitment to avoid government jobs post-retirement.

title: Plea flags Rs 1.7 crore paid to CM daughter without service
content: Kerala High Court has issued notices to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, his daughter T Veena, and others concerning alleged financial dealings between Cochin Minerals and Rutile Ltd and Veena’s firm. This action follows a PIL seeking a CBI inquiry into the matter.

title: Japan to gift two rakes for bullet train tests ahead of August ’26 start
content: Japan will gift India two Shinkansen train sets for inspection on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail corridor, expected by early 2026. These trains will help Indian engineers familiarize themselves with Shinkansen technology. Phase 1 is set to open on a 48 km stretch in Aug 2026, while Maharashtra faces delays due to tunnelling work.

title: Trump vs Harvard: Who may blink first and why it could change US forever
content: A high-stakes constitutional standoff has emerged between Harvard University and the Trump administration over federal demands for ideological conformity. Harvard refuses to yield, citing threats to academic freedom, leading to a $2.2 billion funding freeze. This conflict could redefine the relationship between the government and universities, impacting research, jobs, and the future of free inquiry.

title: Nicholas Suzuki and Sebastian Aho set for intense final-week battle
content: Montreal Canadiens will face Carolina Hurricanes. Canadiens need one point for playoffs. Hurricanes are preparing for a postseason match with New Jersey. Carolina will rest some veterans and introduce new players. Nicholas Suzuki leads Canadiens. Sebastian Aho guides Hurricanes. The game promises drama and a glimpse into the future. Both teams eye the postseason.

title: HC reserves orders on Kamra plea, says no arrest till then
content: The Bombay High Court has granted interim relief to comedian Kunal Kamra, preventing his arrest by Mumbai police until further orders. This comes as the court reserved its decision on Kamra's plea to quash an FIR filed against him over his show.

title: Ladakh hill council passes bill reserving 33% seats for women
content: The BJP-led Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (LAHDC-Leh) has unanimously passed a bill to reserve 33% of seats for women, marking a significant step towards gender equity in the region. This decision by LAHDC-Leh aims to empower women, especially those from rural areas, to participate in leadership roles and contribute to policymaking, aligning with the broader vision of women's empowerment.

title: Encounters exposed infiltration route, hunt on for fugitive terrorists: SSP
content: Kathua SSP Shobhit Saxena revealed that recent encounters in Kathua thwarted a major terror plot. The infiltration route used by Pakistani terrorists has been exposed and blocked. A large cache of arms, ammunition, and drugs was recovered, indicating plans for deadly attacks and a prolonged stay, while security forces are actively pursuing remaining fugitives.

title: Colossal squid caught alive on camera for the first time in 100 years!
content: In a rare sighting, researchers captured the first-ever footage of a juvenile colossal squid in its natural habitat in the South Atlantic. This elusive creature, discovered in 1925, can grow to an enormous size. Marine expert Thom Linley spotted the ghostly figure, initially mistaken for a glass squid. Dr.

title: Big blow for RR! Sanju Samson retires hurt mid-innings vs DC
content: Rajasthan Royals faced a setback as captain Sanju Samson retired hurt during their IPL 2025 match against Delhi Capitals after experiencing rib pain while batting. Samson, who had scored a quick 31, walked off the field, casting doubt on RR's campaign. Earlier, Delhi Capitals posted 188/5, with contributions from Axar Patel, Tristan Stubbs, and Abhishek Porel.

title: 'Wait for greater clarity': US Fed to hold off altering interest rates
content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell announced a hold on interest rate changes, awaiting clarity on President Trump's economic policies. Uncertainty surrounds immigration, tax policy, regulation, and trade tariffs. While tariffs are expected to cause short-lived inflation and slower growth, opinions diverge among Fed officials. Some, like Waller, downplay long-term tariff impacts, while others prioritize inflation control.

title: China willing to begin trade talks with US, but sets several riders
content: China is ready to restart trade talks with the US, demanding respect, a consistent trade policy, and attention to its concerns on sanctions and Taiwan. Beijing seeks a lead negotiator with Trump's full support. This comes after a tariff hike by the US following China's block on Boeing purchases. China also condemned VP Vance's remarks about "Chinese peasants" as ignorant.

title: US Vice President JD Vance to visit India, meeting with PM Modi on agenda
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, will visit Italy and India from April 18-24. In India, Vance will meet PM Modi to discuss economic and geopolitical priorities amidst ongoing tariff discussions. This visit, which includes stops in New Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra, marks Vance's second international trip as Vice President.

title: Samson warned, Sandeep's record over: Rare incidents in DC vs RR
content: The Delhi Capitals vs Rajasthan Royals IPL 2025 match featured unusual incidents. An umpire intervened when Sanju Samson stood too deep to Jofra Archer. Sandeep Sharma then bowled an eventful 11-ball final over, conceding 19 runs due to multiple extras, shifting momentum to Delhi. Sharma joined the list of bowlers with the most deliveries in an IPL over.

title: Sources: UCLA among schools eyeing Iamaleava
content: UCLA has had conversations with representatives of transfer quarterback Nico Iamaleava for less money than he was asking for from Tennessee, sources told ESPN on Wednesday.

title: NBA: Refs made 4 errors late in Grizz-Warriors
content: The NBA on Wednesday said officials made two incorrect calls and two incorrect non-calls in the final two minutes of Golden State's 121-116 play-in win vs. Memphis.

title: Sources: QB Browne among UNC players to portal
content: North Carolina quarterback Ryan Browne is among the Tar Heels entering the transfer portal, sources said Wednesday, as is sacks leader Beau Atkinson.

title: Umpire hit in face by line drive, taken to hospital
content: Umpire Hunter Wendelstedt left the Mets-Twins game on Wednesday after being struck in the face by a line-drive foul ball. He was taken to a hospital for tests.

title: Reigning champ Gators land ex-Princeton star Lee
content: Princeton transfer Xaivian Lee, one of the top point guards in the transfer portal, has picked newly crowned champion Florida over St. John's and Kansas, he announced.

title: Ancelotti: Madrid future in doubt after UCL exit
content: Carlo Ancelotti said he "doesn't know" if Real Madrid's 2-1 Champions League defeat to Arsenal on Wednesday was his last game in charge of Madrid in the competition.

title: NFL draft prospect Bond sues woman over arrest
content: Lawyers for NFL draft prospect Isaiah Bond filed a lawsuit in United States District Court in Northern Texas on Wednesday against a woman who they say made false statements to the Frisco (Texas) Police Department.

title: PGA Tour suspends W. Bryan for playing LIV event
content: The PGA Tour has suspended Wesley Bryan for participating in a LIV Golf-backed event called "The Duels: Miami" two weeks ago.

title: How Paul Skenes is growing into life as MLB's next megastar
content: Amid the noise that comes with achieving superstar status, the Pirates ace finds himself in the quiet.

title: NBA experts' picks for the remaining play-in showdowns
content: Our experts pick which teams make it out of the play-in tournament and which will survive the first round.

title: Bontemps' ballot: Final selections for MVP, All-NBA and every award
content: Who is the MVP? The top rookie? The Defensive Player of the Year? Tim Bontemps reveals his official awards ballot.

title: 'I know how badly they want to win': How the Senators grew into being a playoff team
content: Ottawa is back in the postseason for the first time since 2017 -- with plans to make it an annual occurrence.

title: CFB spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content: The spring transfer period is open. Nico Iamaleava and Gio Lopez are among the top players available.

title: Why Shedeur Sanders' NFL draft process, stardom are like nothing we've seen before
content: Too confident? Too famous? Here's what former Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders faced and why he's sure he'll succeed.

title: 'She can carry a franchise': What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? WNBA GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: Arsenal's maturity seals Arteta's finest night in KO of Madrid
content: Lessons learned in their runner-up Premier League campaigns propelled Arsenal to the Champions League semis.

title: Inter use grit to reach Champions League semis, but they must be better vs. Barcelona
content: Inter qualified for the UEFA Champions League semifinals, but can they improve to eliminate a tough Barcelona side and make it to the final?

title: Ex-MLS forward dies following fall from 11th floor
content: Gabon forward Aaron Boupendza has died at 28 following a fall from the 11th floor of a building in China, the Gabonese Football Federation has said.

title: Tevez targets Ronaldo, Messi for farewell game
content: Carlos Tevez wants former teammates Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to take part in his farewell game in Buenos Aires.

title: Newcastle score 5 to tighten grip on UCL place
content: Jacob Murphy scored one goal and set up another as rampant Newcastle United thumped Crystal Palace 5-0 at St James' Park on Wednesday to go third in the Premier League table with a sixth consecutive win in all competitions.

title: Kane: Penalty style inspired by Neymar, Balotelli
content: Harry Kane has said he adapted his penalty-taking technique after watching Brazilian forward Neymar and other high-profile spot-kick specialists.

title: Maresca defends Chelsea style amid fan discontent
content: Chelsea are moving in the right direction and developing a playing style that will help them in the long run, coach Enzo Maresca said on Wednesday in an impassioned defence of his players who were jeered over the weekend.

title: Van de Ven: Spurs want UEL win for Postecoglou
content: Micky van de Ven has said Tottenham Hotspur players want to win the Europa League for under-fire manager Ange Postecoglou.

title: Rashford's future undecided after Villa UCL exit
content: Unai Emery said the future of on-loan Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford "depends on the next weeks."

title: Amorim: Onana to return for Man United vs. Lyon
content: André Onana will return to the Manchester United team for their crucial Europa League clash against Lyon, head coach Ruben Amorim has confirmed.

title: What comes next for the flailing Suns -- and Kevin Durant
content: After firing their third coach in three years, the Suns' next -- and perhaps only -- move is trading Kevin Durant.

title: Surprise teams, contenders and OU's quest to five-peat: Big questions for the rest of the softball season
content: Is anyone outpitching NiJaree Canady? Which teams are serious contenders? Bill Connelly dives into the 2025 college softball season thus far.

title: Previewing the NCAA gymnastics championships
content: Can LSU defend its title? Or will OU get redemption? What to watch as the NCAA gymnastics championships begin Thursday.

title: 2025-26 Way-Too-Early Top 25: Teams on the rise in version 2.0
content: Texas Tech and BYU climb our Way-Too-Early 2025-26 rankings thanks to key player returns and portal additions.

title: Why Aaliyah Chavez is no longer No. 1 in the final 2025 class rankings
content: The final high school player rankings saw big jumps -- including Jasmine Davidson taking over as the best player in the 2025 ESPN 100.

title: How Tennessee coach Josh Heupel scored one for coaches everywhere
content: By refusing quarterback Nico Iamaleava's NIL demand, Heupel and Tennessee took a stand for the good of the program.

title: College baseball's next big thing: Rintaro Sasaki
content: Rintaro Sasaki chose to play for Stanford over going pro in Japan, so what exactly brought him to college baseball?

title: Congress enters China doping clash between U.S., WADA
content: Outrage lingers on Capitol Hill over swimmers testing positive for banned substance before 2021 Olympics.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea eyeing summer move for Delap
content: Chelsea are pushing to sign Ipswich Town's Liam Delap ahead of a potential summer move. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who earned a spot, Volkanovski or Jandiroba?
content: There's a new featherweight champion and new strawweight No. 1 contender -- but just one is in ESPN's top 10.

title: Who will new featherweight champ Volkanovski fight in first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility?

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

title: Jalen Hurts among several sports stars on Time's '100 Most Influential People of 2025' list
content: The Philadelphia Eagles quarterback joined Serena Williams, Simone Biles and others on the list of sports figures to be honored.

title: Connor McDavid leads second round of EA Sports NHL 25 Team of the Season
content: The second batch of honorees has been announced, including the Oilers superstar, with one more group to come.

title: DGCA may review framework for pilot fitness, other aspects
content: The plan also comes against the backdrop of the death of an Air India Express pilot due to a medical condition in the national capital earlier this month soon after operating a flight from Srinagar

title: Rishikesh-Karnaprayag rail link project: Vaishnaw witnesses breakthrough of longest rail tunnel in Uttarakhand
content: The 14.57-km-long tunnel no 8 between Devprayag and Janasu is part of the ambitious 125-km Rishikesh-Karnaprayag Broad Gauge Rail Link Project in Uttarakhand

title: Heat island push to city’s scorching summer temperature
content: Research shows that the temperature within the Urban Heat Island areas could be 3 to 5 degrees higher than the surroundings, dramatically worsening citizens’ lives

title: 16th Finance Commission team lauds WhatsApp governance model in A.P.
content: The goal is to provide up to 1,000 services through WhatsApp, Chief Minister informs the delegation

title: Amaravati needs an international airport to attract foreign investments, says Minister Narayana
content: The State government is committed to fulfilling all the promises that have been made to the farmers in the capital region, says Narayana

title: Modi will set capital construction works in motion on May 2, says Chief Secy.
content: Vijayanand said the place where Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu launched the P-4 initiative was finalised as the venue for the event

title: Got old clothes? Here’s a business card to dispose them of
content: The initiative is part of BBC Media Action’s newly launched ‘Got Old Clothes?’ campaign that aims to urge people of Bengaluru to responsibly discard their old clothes.

title: Why accused with multiple disciplinary complaints lodged with Christian Michel, Delhi Court asks police
content: The court was responding to an application filed by James, in which he requested to provide adequate security measures in the barrack. He also alleged that his tea was being poisoned and that he faced life threats.

title: After months of separation, Nidhi and parents reconnect through a virtual meet
content: The videoconference was arranged by the Ernakulam Town North police, who had registered a case against the girl’s parents for abandoning her shortly after her birth

title: Coastal population in Ernakulam hit by tidal flooding to get relief
content: They can now apply for relief in the prescribed pro forma to the village offices concerned. Once the applications are received, the authorities will verify them, based on which the relief will be decided

title: Caste census report: All eyes are on special Cabinet meeting
content: Meeting comes in the midst of one-upmanship between political leaders and community leaders belonging to Vokkaligas and Veerashaiva-Lingayats, who are opposing the report, and the backward classes leaders, who have termed the report to be ‘scientific’

title: ISF MLA Nawshad Siddique named in FIR on Bhangar violence
content: Siddique said that “unarmed and peaceful” protesters were arrested. “We abide by the law, but we will not let this slide,” he added

title: Continue existing 41% devolution of tax revenues to States: BJP leaders
content: Continue the revenue deficit grant for States having the post-tax devolution revenue deficit as per the existing parameters, request 20-Point Programme Chairman Lanka Dinakar and Jammalamadugu MLA Ch. Adinaryana Reddy to to 16th Finance Commission Chairman

title: West Godavari police win top prize at crime detection awards
content: Sri Satya Sai police solve child murder; Vizianagaram cops bust digital fraud, recover cash and jewellery; Guntur police get consolation prize

title: Nanguneri teen, who was hacked by schoolmates in 2023, attacked again
content: Police suspect that the attackers might be linked to those who orchestrated the attack on the boy in August 2023 or the same group involved in the earlier attack.

title: ‘Bifurcation blues’ still weigh heavy on A.P., Naidu tells 16th Finance Commission
content: Division of assets worth ₹39,191 crore belonging to 142 institutions is yet to be completed even as 10 years have passed  the bifurcation, says the Chief Minister

title: Devolution of shares: A.P. wants ‘income distance’ weightage to be reduced to 30%, says Finance Commission Chairman
content: The Finance Commission will make decisions after doing a thorough assessment of the States’ requirements, says Panagariya

title: Tension mounts in Etah as Dalit alleges assault after vandalisation of Kalyan Singh’s statue
content: Some members of the Dalit community have also alleged that anti-social elements entered their homes and assaulted the residents, including women and children

title: Samagra Shiksha invites applications for admissions to Class 1 under Right to Education Act
content: State to fill 25% Class 1 seats in private schools under RTE Act from April 28 to May 15 for 2025-26 academic year

title: Woman, son ‘beat three puppies to death’; six more accused of defanging dog with pliers
content: Three puppies were allegedly beaten to death in M.P.; the cruelty continued in a neighbouring village where another dog was defanged with pliers

title: People of T.N. no longer want DMK in power, voter sentiment strongly favouring a change, says Nainar Nagenthran
content: Newly elected BJP Tamil Nadu president Nainar Nagenthran hits out at the DMK government for ‘unfulfilled’ poll promises and deteriorating law and order in State, among other issues. He further says that the anti-incumbency factor in the State in the last four years has been over 20%

title: Mamata should quit, says BJP; party stages protest in Kolkata
content: LoP asks Calcutta HC for permission to visit riot-hit areas; seeks NIA probe; CM announces ₹10 lakh compensation for kin of three people killed in violence; Congress says CM must visit affected areas

title: Five military personnel honoured with MacGregor memorial medals
content: The award celebrates outstanding contributions in military reconnaissance, exploration and adventure for the years 2023 and 2024

title: Former diplomat declines Trinamool Congress MP’s offer to settle defamation suit in Delhi High Court
content: Former U.N. Assistant Secretary General Lakshmi Murdeshwar Puri refused the settlement offer, with her counsel contending that Saket Gokhale had abused her without any basis

title: Tiger kills seven-year-old boy at Ranthambore National Park
content: The forest officials launched a rescue operation and located the tiger with the corpse deep inside the forest

title: Northeastern region is the gateway to Southeast Asia, says Jaishankar
content: Fortnight after Muhammad Yunus described the region as ‘landlocked’, External Affairs Minister says the northeast is at the ‘heart of many key Indian policies’

title: Remove caste references in school, college names, orders Madras High Court
content: The judgement was passed while disposing of a batch of writ petitions filed by South Indian Senguntha Mahajana Sangam, Tiruchengode Vatta Kongu Velalar Sangam and The Poor Educational Fund.

title: U.P. cleric asks Muslims to distance themselves from Vijay
content: Accusing the actor as anti-Muslim to the core, by portraying Muslims as terrorist in some of his films, Mr. Razvi added Mr. Vijay aimed to tarnish the image of Muslims hence it is necessary for Muslims to maintain gap with the political party, the actor formed and should not extend support

title: CM throws his weight behind Divya S. Iyer who came under fire for lauding K.K. Ragesh’s election as CPI(M)‘s Kannur district secretary
content: The IAS officer had created political controversy and, later, came under Opposition fire for lauding K.K. Ragesh, Mr. Vijayan’s political secretary, for his election as the district secretary of the CPI(M) in Kannur

title: Mahadev App case: ED raids over 50 locations, including EaseMyTrip co-founder residence
content: The ED has earlier claimed that its probe revealed the involvement of several top politicians and bureaucrats from Chhattisgarh and that the proceeds of crime were about ₹6,000 crore in the case

title: T.N. restrains govt. staff from writing books criticising State policies
content: Conduct rules amended to restrict public servants from accepting remuneration or royalty from publishers

title: Opposition slams Mahayuti govt. over alleged cuts to Ladki Bahin scheme
content: Aaditya Thackeray mocked the ruling coalition’s credibility, calling it a “demonic alliance” propped up by the Election Commission’s “blessings”

title: Licence of Madhya Pradesh hospital suspended following ‘fake doctor’ row
content: The Mission Hospital in Damoh has been instructed to not admit any new patients and to shift its patients to the district hospital, or discharge eligible patients within the next three days

title: Waqf-by-user denotification would be ‘huge problem’, says Supreme Court
content: Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna, hearing around 100 petitions over the Waqf (Amendment) Act, proposes a three-point interim order to ‘balance equities’; court adjourns without passing any interim order

title: 3 agents held for attempting to send a Punjab resident to Canada on a fake passport
content: Police have registered an FIR against all three accused and are further probing their financial transactions and exploring their involvement in similar immigration frauds

title: Mehbooba expresses concern over Murshidabad violence
content: She said as a community we must channelise our energies constructively to upholding our constitutional rights through peaceful and lawful means

title: CM accuses IUML of letting down the national cause against the “anti-Muslim” Waqf Act 2025
content: CM says IUML-controlled Cannanore District Muslim Educational Association leased Waqf land from the Juma Masjid authorities in 1967. Later, it claimed that the land was a private bequest and not Waqf as per the original lease agreement

title: ED working as a BJP wing, says Bihar Congress in-charge Krishna Allavaru
content: Congress workers stage protest, hurl shoes and slippers at Patna’s ED office after agency’s chargesheet against Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case

title: Worried about ‘decline’ in stand-up quality, RSS cultural wing seeks to ‘reestablish Indian values in comedy’
content: Sanskar Bharti says comedy could be used as a tool for social reform, but is becoming a “shortcut to fame” instead; under the guise of free expression, artists mock religion, national heroes, social practices, it adds

title: Nagpur violence: civic chief apologises to HC over illegal demolitions, claims ignorance of SC guidelines
content: Division Bench grants the State government two weeks to respond, while noting the administration’s overreach

title: CPI leader objects allegations of cow deaths at TTD’s goshala
content: Narayana visits the dairy farm premises in Tirupati and interacts with the officials, staff members, including the animal keepers who closely monitor the developments pertaining to the animal sheds

title: Akhilesh Yadav asks Centre to refrain from interfering in the affairs of States
content: After Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin’s move to form a three-member high-level committee to review the constitutional provisions governing Centre-State relations, the Samajwadi Party leader said autonomy and federalism should be respected

title: Hartal in protest against wildlife attacks total in Athirappilly
content: Three tribespeople were killed within a span of 48 hours in the area in attacks by wild elephants. Shops stayed shut and public and private transport came to a halt across the region

title: Pawar backs aspirants’ demand for more MPSC vacancies
content: NCP(SP) chief Sharad Pawar argued that increasing vacancies would align with the MPSC’s recent decision to raise the qualifying age limit for candidates

title: Call for mass fast to mark 2000th day of public demand to protect Chellanam-Fort Kochi coast
content: Chellanam-Kochi Janakeeya Vedi leaders have appealed to residents of the coastal village to join the hunger strike from wherever they are in the world and to send in pictures and reports of their participation in the mass actio

title: IISR develops light-coloured turmeric
content: The new product with high yield and pleasant aroma comes out after a decade-long research by a team of five scientists

title: State govt. to consider giving 60% incentives to attract industries to backward areas
content: Siddaramaiah promises considering the proposal made by AICC president Mallikarjun Kharge during the inauguration of mega job fair in Kalaburagi

title: Centre, State govt.s using Munambam issue for political gains, says Thangal
content: Says Union Minister for Minority Affairs Kiren Rijiju’s latest statement that the Munambam residents could take legal recourse to address their concerns validated the IUML’s stand

title: Beat patrol to be reintroduced in Kozhikode to combat drug trafficking
content: Preparations are under way in the district to assign beats to police officers who will be collaborating with local residents to step up day-and-night patrol

title: Donald Trump Suggests Tariffs Capable Of Replacing Income Tax
content: During this era, the US experienced unprecedented wealth, with Trump noting, "And that's when our nation was relatively the richest. We were the richest."

title: Maldives Bans Israeli Passport Holders In Protest Against Gaza War
content: The Maldives has banned Israeli passport holders from entering its territory, the president's office said on Wednesday, accusing Israel of committing genocide against Palestinians in the Gaza war, an allegation Israel has repeatedly denied.

title: Supreme Court To Resume Hearing Of Petitions Against Waqf Bill Today
content: The Supreme Court will continue hearing a batch of petitions challenging the constitutional validity of the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 on Thursday.

title: Israel Says One-Third Of Gaza Now Under Its Military Control
content: The Israeli military has said it is expanding the "Morag Corridor," a new dividing line in the southern Gaza Strip, and has turned roughly a third of the enclave into "security zones" under full Israeli military control.

title: West Bengal Police Forms Special Team To probe Murshidabad Violence
content: West Bengal Police has constituted a nine-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the recent incidents of violence in Murshidabad district, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Denies Meta Bought Rivals To Conquer Them
content: Meta chief executive Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday denied in court that his company bought rival services Instagram and WhatsApp to neutralize them, as his testimony in a landmark antitrust case came to a close.

title: Turkey Says Over 175,000 Syrians Return Home Since December
content: A total of 175,512 Syrians have voluntarily returned to their country from Turkey since December 9 last year, Turkish Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya said.

title: Beijing Red-Faced As Ukraine Breaks Humanitarian Law To Prove China Wrong
content: After China's outright denial of its citizens fighting the war alongside Russians, Ukraine decided to take some drastic actions.

title: Trump's Trade War Ripples Through Business World, Hits Stocks Again
content: The ripple effects of Trump's global trade war are increasingly being felt across numerous industries all at once and on Wednesday were once again exerting pressure on U.S. stock markets that have been roiled for weeks by his erratic trade policies.

title: Amid Reshuffle Buzz, BJP Holds Key Meet At PM Modi's Residence
content: An important meeting of top BJP leadership was held on Wednesday in Delhi regarding the party's organisational elections, in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Indian-Origin Doctor Elected President Of UK's Royal College Of Physicians
content: Dr Mumtaz Patel has been elected as the 123rd president of the Royal College of Physicians (RCP), a high-profile role heading the UK's medical professional membership body representing 40,000 members around the world.

title: Gold Hits All-Time High At Rs 98,100, Silver Jumps Rs 1,900
content: Gold prices soared by Rs 1,650 to hit an all-time high of Rs 98,100 per 10 grams in the national capital on Wednesday amid a global rush for the safe-haven asset triggered by an escalated trade war between the US and China.

title: 'Inaction Deeply Troubling': Meitei Body Writes To Amit Shah Over Threat To Pilgrims
content: A civil society group of Manipur's Meitei community has requested Union Home Minister Amit Shah to look into threats by "Chin-Kuki militants" who blocked Meitei pilgrims from going to a hilltop shrine.

title: Adani Electricity Observes Fire Service Week Across Power Distribution Area
content: In a bid to promote fire prevention, Adani Electricity on Wednesday said it is observing Fire Service Week' from April 14-20 throughout its power distribution area.

title: Appreciation Of Farooq Abdullah, Not Criticism: Ex Spy On Article 370 Claim
content: AS Dulat, former chief of Research and Analysis Wing and the author of the explosive memoir "Chief Minister and the Spy", said today that the book was laudatory towards the former Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir, Farooq Abdullah.

title: Japanese Chef Wins Michelin Star, Fulfills Promise Made To Dying Husband
content: Chizuko Kimura has become the first female sushi chef in the world to win a Michelin star, fulfilling a promise she made to her dying husband to continue his legacy.

title: Fire Erupts At Hospital, Patient Dies As Oxygen Mask Removed During Evacuation
content: One person was killed as a fire erupted in the old building of Morena District Hospital, engulfing the main operation theatre, burn unit, and surgical ward on Wednesday.

title: Zuckerberg Considered "Spinning Instagram Out" Over Antitrust Worries
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg once considered separating Instagram from its parent company due to worries about antitrust litigation, according to an email shown Tuesday on the second day of an antitrust trial.

title: Vijay Shekhar Sharma Surrenders 2.1 Crore Paytm Shares Worth Rs 1,800 Crore
content: Fintech firm One97 Communications' Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Vijay Shekhar Sharma has voluntarily surrendered 2.1 crore shares worth about Rs 1,800 crore, as per a regulatory filing and share closing price of the company.

title: "No Police Protection If Marrying Against Parents' Wishes": High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has observed that couples who marry of their own will against the wishes of their parents cannot claim police protection as a matter of right unless there is a real threat perception to their life and liberty.

title: Saudi Arabian Grand Prix: Schedule predictions, stats
content: red bull have won three out of four races at the jeddah corniche Circuit . it's forecast to be hot, dry and settled in the desert this weekend . Saudi Arabia's Prince Khalid bin Sultan al-Abdullah al-Faisal is interested in owning an F1 team .

title: Ian Darke's Premier League stars of the season: Salah, Isak, more
content: Mohamed Salah is currently top of the premier league with 27 goals and 18 assists through 32 games . but are there other serious contenders? you can expect Salah to collect the PFA Player of the Year award and the historic Football Writers' Association footballer of the year trophy .

title: Fled marriage, lived at stations: ‘Dead’ Army soldier returns after 16 years
content: Ajay Sura is Senior Assistant Editor with The Times of India Chandigarh. He covers news concerning the State of Haryana, Punjab & Haryana High Court and Defence & Military Affairs. He likes to analyse political developments and decoding judicial pronouncements. His hobbies include travelling, mountaineering and trekking. title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's draft performance
content: andraya Carter is a big fan of the Washington Mystics' three first-round picks in the 2025 WNBA draft . a couple of teams have a solid chance to make the roster . there's always a chance for teams to prove these grades wrong, sometimes for better .
